tha-ap419:0.3_0: Hearing this flower, the senior monks,
tha-ap419:1.4_0: for it is the eighth day.
tha-ap419:2.1_0: At a time when the Buddha tread,
tha-ap419:2.2_0: at the fore of the mendicant Saṅgha;
tha-ap419:3.1_0: Seeing the light of the world,
tha-ap419:3.2_0: the world who sees the world.
tha-ap419:4.3_0: I’m not aware of any bad places
tha-ap419:5.1_0: My defilements have been burnt away by practicing absorption—
tha-ap419:7.1_0: Attaining the four kinds of textual analysis
tha-ap419:8.1_0: That is how these verses were recited by the senior venerable Kajaṅgala.
